alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Utah County through 430 PM MDT... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Mountain, or 8 miles west of Payson, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Provo, Payson, Orem, Lehi, Spanish Fork, Pleasant Grove, Springville, American Fork, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Santaquin, Salem, Elk Ridge, Woodland Hills, Cedar Fort, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Palmyra, Lake Shore and Benjamin. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Utah Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 243 and 281. US Route 6 between mile markers 142 and 145, and between mile markers 154 and 174. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
